programme.title: Drag Kids
programme.desc: Drag has always been about breaking down barriers and daring to do the unexpected. Now, a new type of queen is on the scene: she's fierce, she's living in a time of unprecedented access to queer culture, and she's younger than ever before. She's a drag kid and she's a long way from the era of the queens who led the Stonewall Riots nearly 50 years ago. Stephan, Jason, Bracken and Nemis have never met, but they're united by a shared passion for drag. They are about to come together for the first time - to perform Lady Gaga's 'Born This Way' at the world-famous Montreal Pride Festival. As they prepare for the big show, each faces their own unique challenges, as well as challenges they have in common - deep feelings of isolation and the struggle of trying to claim a place of your own on the fringes of a fringe culture. Drag Kids is a beautiful, daring, and touching portrait of four kids chasing freedom and friendship through the art of drag.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Needle in the Haystack" - Jeffrey Ortiz, a mentally challenged man with the mental capacity of a nine-year-old, is making himself a sandwich when he inexplicably falls, striking his head on the kitchen counter.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "A Lingering Question" - When the husband, Tao Chen, is shot to death by his wife Jun, she claims she pulled the trigger in self-defense when a drunken Tao came after her with a gun.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Kiss of Death?" - After a brief illness, 34-year old Claire Jackson dies suddenly in the hospital from massive liver failure and winds up in Dr. G's morgue.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "The Desperate Crossing" - A quadriplegic woman loved by her community is found dead in an Orlando park 150ft from her motorized wheelchair. Children find her lifeless body face down in the sand.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Dangerous Forces" - Jerra Kirby, who's visiting family in Orlando, has suddenly passed out at a theme park wave pool and the paramedics are trying desperately to revive her.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Poison Control" - Chris Schaffer has not been seen or heard from in five days. Finally, his friends find him dead and decomposed in the driver's seat of his van.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Deadly Consequences" - Ricky Hawthorne, a middle-aged man with a history of AIDS, arrives at his local hospital complaining of chest pains. Doctors perform extensive tests on him but find nothing wrong and release him.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Deadly Arrest" - Police are driving down the street when a man suddenly jumps in front of their car. They screech to a halt and avoid hitting him, but the man is highly agitated.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "On The Run" - Teenagers stumble across a horrifying car fire on the side of a desolate stretch of roadway. When the police arrive, they pull severely burned human remains from the driver's seat.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Old Wounds Run Deep" - A retired military officer is found dead in his own backyard during a freak ice storm in San Antonio, Texas.

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 5
programme.desc: This examination of the role autopsies play in murder investigations focuses on the suspicious death of Virginia Ridley. Police charge her mentally unstable husband with murder, but a medical examiner discovers that she died of natural causes.

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 5
programme.desc: When the decomposed body of a teenage girl is discovered, police have no clues to her identity. To solve the case, investigators turn to bug larvae found on the body and a tiny wad of chewing gum found near the victim's body.

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 5
programme.desc: Police suspect Dr. John "Jack" Boyle in the disappearance of his wife, Noreen, when he signs mortgage papers for a new house with a woman pretending to be his spouse. The police later find Noreen's body in the basement of Dr. Boyle's new house.

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 5
programme.desc: Survivors of Nazi atrocities recognized Archbishop Trifa, former head of the Romanian Orthodox Church in America, as having directed a bloody attack against Jews during World War II. He was deported in 1984 and died three years later.

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 5
programme.desc: In this international case of extortion, murder and stolen identities, scam-artist Albert J. Walker assumes the identity of co-worker Ronald Platt. Platt later turns up dead in an ocean with an anchor tied around his torso.

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 5
programme.desc: When heart surgeon Darryl Sutorius is found dead in the basement of his upscale Cincinnati home, police assume he committed suicide. Further investigation reveals that his new wife Della has a history of violence and an insatiable desire for money.

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 5
programme.desc: 6-year-old Nicole Rae Walker was killed in a hit-and-run in her Ft. Lauderdale neighborhood. The prosecutor combines the talents of an accident reconstruction expert with a video specialist to create a graphic demonstration of the moment of impact.

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 5
programme.desc: When convenience store employee Wanda Mason is found dead, investigators find the entire murder has been caught on the store's security camera. But the image of the killer is so degraded it seems impossible to positively identify him.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman was reported missing after a fight with her husband. Police were suspicious of a suspect who reported a fire in his car. Two tiny drops of blood were found in the interior. A tiny clue inside the suspect's watchband helped solve the case.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1991, Maine resident Pearl Smith is missing after an argument with her husband Bill Bruns. . But, when an investigation turns up a blood trail that leads to the couple's basement, police are sure they'll find the victim's body.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1989, 4-year-old April Loveless was found dead in the backyard of her Texas home. Her mother Debbie Loveless and step-father John Miller told police that she was attacked and killed by the family dogs. Investigators did not agree.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1996, 17-month-old Josh Hinson died in a fire which a federal agency ruled was intentionally set by Josh's mother Terri Strickland. Using the then-emerging resources of the Internet, Terri Strickland undertook her own investigation.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1988, when a patient dies unexpectedly in the office of California neurologist Richard Boggs, police begin what they think will be a routine investigation.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: One investigator's quick thinking helps him capture a shoe impression made in snow before the evidence melts away.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1992, 22-year-old Dawn Bruce is brutally murdered in her Virginia apartment. Investigators notice a blood smear on a pillow case that appears to have been made by one of the killer's fingers.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Professional photographer Charles Rathbun claims model Linda Sobek died during a consensual sexual encounter gone wrong, but Sobek's corpse and some high tech digital imagery tell a more sinister story.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1998, an evening out at a Maryland murder mystery theatre performance turns into a real life whodunit when the badly burned body of Stephen Hricko is discovered in his hotel room after a fire.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1980, Michigan resident Shannon Mohr died in what was reported to be a horseback riding accident by her new husband David Davis. After her death, Shannon's family reported to police their suspicions that Davis seemed far from grief-stricken.

programme.title: Fear Factor 2.0

All is the hopes of winning $100,000.

programme.title: Fear Factor 2.0

programme.title: Fear Factor 2.0
programme.desc: "Snake Bite" - Four couples compete for a grand prize of $50,000. programme.title: Fear Factor 2.0
programme.desc: "Roach Coach" - Four teams of two compete for $50,000 as they are locked in a cage and sunk underwater, eat a disgusting meal from the Fear Factor Roach Coach consisting of roaches, grasshoppers, blood salsa and maggots and lastly must leap back and forth from a moving station wagon onto a bus.

programme.title: Fear Factor 2.0
programme.desc: "Broken Hearts & Blood Baths" - Four teams of exes must deal with 3 stunts and each other. programme.title: Fear Factor 2.0
programme.desc: "Tall Crappacino" - Four teams of two attempt to win $50,000. They face three extreme stunts as they are stuck in a car being flown under two helicopters, must drink a Fear Factor Crappacino and lastly are dropped through a collapsing tower.

programme.title: Big Deer TV: Hot & Cold
programme.desc: Mike and Graig Hale run into rutting bucks and a big surprise in Alabama.

programme.title: Big Deer TV: Old School Deer Hunt, Part 1
programme.desc: Mike and friends hunt deer and hogs at Gopher Plantation, a replica of a South Georgia farm as existed at the turn of the 19th century.

programme.title: RMEF Team Elk: A Little More Country
programme.desc: Team Elk welcomes country singer Easton Corbin to the team as he experiences his first elk hunt in a big way.

programme.title: Lindner's Angling Edge: The Muskies of Las Seul
programme.desc: Jeremy Smith and Pete Przepiora chase early-fall muskies from a houseboat on Ontario’s famed Lac Seul.

programme.title: Jim Shockey's Uncharted: Yukon: Challenging the Impossible
programme.desc: Jim says goodbye to clients Nate and Chet while Roddy tries to get Client Shaun a last minute moose. Bryan welcomes a new client and Matt attempts to do the impossible and find two moose in his sparse camp.

programme.title: Jim Shockey's Hunting Adventures: Bear Hunting with the Hornadys
programme.desc: Jim Shockey guide Jason and Steve Hornady in his Vancouver Island Pacific Rim Outfitting territory.

programme.title: McMillan: Turkey Troubles
programme.desc: Tom guides his son through the ups and downs of a turkey hunt, where patience is the name of the game.

programme.title: Bowhunter TV: Wyoming Luck
programme.desc: Bowhunter Contributor Matt Palmquist enjoys the luck of the draw on a DIY elk hunt in south-central Wyoming.

programme.title: North American Whitetail TV: Bar J Showdown
programme.desc: Dr. James Kroll and Rob Hughes hunt Texas Bar J Ranch with their Browning rifles. The importance of patience in land management is the subject of our Build Your Own Deer Factory. We close out with Gordon Whittington's profile of a vintage non-typical from the backwoods of Maine.

programme.title: Big Deer TV: Rut Rendezvous 1
programme.desc: Like moths to flame, Mike Hanback and friends are drawn to the Red Hills of Oklahoma for the November rut. Trijicon's Chuck Wahr encounters a big buck in shifting winds and Mike hits the ground with Scott Sanderford of Croton Creek Outfitters.

programme.title: Sporting Chef, The: Wine Country Blacktails
programme.desc: Scott meets up with Adam Weatherby in Paso Robles, California for a warm weather opener at Steinbeck Vineyards. Local deer, wine and produce make for a memorable few days of hunting in the rolling hills of Central Coast wine country.

programme.title: Florida Sportsman Best Boat: Croswait 21, Robalo R242 Explorer, Jupiter 34 HFS
programme.desc: Today, on Florida Sportsman Best Boat...For serious anglers who desire a versatile fishing platform with loads of style, we'll be taking a look at the Croswait Custom 21 If you are equally interested in family entertainment and heading offshore, we'll be taking a look at the Robalo R242 Explorer For those who demand a boat with hardcore bluewater capability and the utmost attention to detail, we'll be taking a look at Jupiter 34 HFS.

programme.title: Florida Adventure Quest: Gulf Sharks
programme.desc: Show host, Jason South joins Capt. Wes Bedell off the coast of Southwest Florida in the Gulf of Mexico. The search is on for big sharks

programme.title: Florida Sportsman Project Dreamboat: 23’ Seacraft Transformation, Classic 28’ Ricky Scarborough
programme.desc: Wildfire Marine continues the transformation on the 23 Seacraft project George LaBonte joins dreamboat owner Norm Bekoff aboard his classic 1977 28 Ricky Scarborough and...Two Rivers Boatworks adds a custom touch on the engines for the 27 Stuart Boatworks build.

programme.title: North American Whitetail: Ol' Mexico Double
programme.desc: Dr. James Kroll hunts giant mule deer in Mexico at the El Chaparral Ranch. In "On Target" we discuss ammunition selection. Later, we explain whitetail travel corridors and profile a monster set of Indiana sheds.

programme.title: Zona's Awesome Fishing Show: Phil Marks - Texas
programme.desc: Phil Marks is arguably one of the best anglers in the state of Texas and that is no small statement. When he and Z get together they morph into quite the team. Throw them on some summertime water in East Texas and they are going to do some damage.

programme.title: The Raven Project S1:E1 "Raven Show One Alpha"

programme.title: Two Conchs Sportfishing TV S3:E1 "Fish for Jose"
programme.desc: Captain Jack Carlson and the crew are celebrating a very special individual that Southern Florida remembers well, Jose Wejebe. Through his daughter Krissy and the Jose Wejebe Memorial Foundation, many individuals have had their fishing dreams come true. This year at the 2020 Fish For Jose Event and Auction, Jack's putting up a day of fishing with the Two Conchs crew as a prize, in an effort to pass along the Spanish Fly spirit that Jose was so well known for.

programme.title: Kingfish Mayhem TV S1:E1 "What is Kingfish Mayhem TV?"

programme.title: Kingfish Mayhem TV S1:E2 "Key West Mayhem Part 1"
programme.desc: Jump on board Team Time Served, Team Digger Rich and Team Kingpin at the Meat Mayhem Pro Series, Leg 1 in Key West, Florida.

programme.title: Reel Animals S15:E1 "Cajun Fishing Adventures"

programme.title: Silver Kings S6:E1 "Bahamas Bonefish Part 1"

programme.title: The Given Right S5:E1 "Jaclyns Dream Hunt"

programme.title: Sporting Classics S2:E1 "A Mayan Fowl Play"

programme.title: Storytellers S1:E1 "The Hill"
programme.desc: This is the story of how FE Hill ranch got it's start. From its inception, FE Hill has created opportunities for people to experience the outdoors and create memories. For us, it has created a tradition of Fathers and Sons hunting together.

programme.title: Storytellers S1:E2 "Axis In July"
programme.desc: Texas is the home to many exotic species that can be hunted. One species in particular, Axis, have a very large population. Our team got together and had a great time hanging out with a land owner and hunting Axis deer.

programme.title: Behind The Season ALASKA " We’re NOT in Kansas Anymore"

programme.title: Behind The Season ALASKA "Oh the Irony"

programme.desc: It's the beginning of a New Year and we kick off the season at the Historic Lake Okeechobee. Join me as I try to get the year started off right on the Major League Fishing Pro Circuit. Things don't always go as planned in this sport, but that is why we love it! Adversity is the name of the game sometimes, and we have to react accordingly! Let's get it started and go catch some bass!

programme.title: Lunkerville S13:E1 "Ice Fishing for Donkeys"

programme.title: One World Kitchen
programme.desc: Hana shows us how to use ponzu sauce, a citrus-based sauce that is a favorite in Japanese cuisine.

programme.title: Spencer's BIG 30
programme.desc: Spencer shares his favorite recipes for quick and budget-friendly pizza.

programme.title: Showstopper Desserts
programme.desc: When entertaining, we like desserts that look more complicated to prepare than they really are. A chocolate mousse cake requires a minimum of ingredients and comes together in minutes, but it is sure to elicit the proper oohs and aahs from guests. And a chilled lemon soufflé is made from basic ingredients that you probably have in your kitchen right now.

programme.title: Summer Tomatoes
programme.desc: What's the best way to enjoy summer tomatoes? It's hard to argue with a recipe that goes something like this: Slice, salt, and serve. Still, there are times when you want to use tomatoes in more elaborate dishes, and gazpacho and a cheesy tart are two of our favorites.

programme.title: Appetizers
programme.desc: We like appetizers that deliver big flavor without much work. This means spiced nuts that are not overly sweet, spinach dip that is bold and creamy (not watery and insipid), and beef satay that is tender and vibrant.

programme.title: Let's Talk Turkey
programme.desc: Thanksgiving can strike fear into the heart of even the most proficient cook. First, there's the turkey to contend with-in no other meal is the main course paraded in front of guests with as much fanfare. Sweet potato casserole is often considered another must-have. With our recipes for these Thanksgiving standards, we minimize the work so that the cook can enjoy the holiday as much as everyone else.

programme.title: Grilled Pizza
programme.desc: We set out to develop a hassle-free pizza recipe especially for the grill-one we hope will become a new backyard barbecue favorite.

programme.title: More Tex-Mex Favorites
programme.desc: We create tasty versions of two Tex-Mex favorites: chicken fajitas and huevos rancheros.

programme.title: Chocolate Delights
programme.desc: Bridget and Julia uncover the secrets to making Foolproof All-Butter Pie Dough and Chocolate Cream Pie, and tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges Bridget to a tasting of cocoa powder. Finally, test cook Elle Simone makes Julia a decadent Dark Chocolate Fudge Sauce.

programme.title: The Perfect Cake
programme.desc: Bridget and Julia make the perfect Gingerbread Layer Cake and Keith Makes Sticky Toffee Pudding Cakes.

programme.title: The Perfect Cookie
programme.desc: Test cook Dan Souza makes Julia a festive recipe for Easy Holiday Sugar Cookies. Equipment expert Adam Ried reveals his top pick for parchment paper, and gadget critic Lisa McManus reviews silicone baking mats. Test cook Lan Lam then makes Bridget the Best Lemon Bars.

programme.title: Holiday Feast
programme.desc: Test cook Ashley Moore shows host Bridget Lancaster how to make a Crumb-Crusted Rack of Lamb that is perfect for the holidays. Next, equipment expert Adam Ried shows host Julia Collin Davison his top picks of electric knives. Finally, test cook Christie Morrison shows Julia how to make a showstopping Brussels Sprout Gratin.

programme.title: Pub-Style Favorites, Revisited
programme.desc: Hosts Julia Collin Davison and Bridget Lancaster uncover the secrets to making the ultimate Pub-Style Steak and Ale Pie at home. Then, equipment expert Adam Ried reveals his top pick for knife blocks. Finally, test cook Keith Dresser makes Bridget perfect Boston Brown Bread.

programme.title: Soup for Dinner
programme.desc: Test cook Dan Souza and host Julia Collin Davison make Chicken Bouillabaisse, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges Bridget to a tasting of cinnamon, and then Julia and Bridget uncover the secrets to Avgolemono.

programme.title: How to Roast Everything
programme.desc: Bridget and Julia teach viewers how to make the ultimate Beef Tenderloin with Smoky Potatoes and Persillade Relish. Tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges Bridget to a turkey tasting. Gadget critic Lisa McManus reviews fat separators, and then test cook Dan Souza makes Turkey Breast en Cocotte with Pan Gravy.

programme.title: Roast Beef and Potatoes
programme.desc: Test cook Natalie Estrada reveals the secrets to making a foolproof Classic Roast Beef Tenderloin with host Bridget Lancaster. Next, host Julia Collin Davison discovers equipment expert Adam Ried's top pick of tongs. Finally, test cook Lawman Johnson shows Julia how to make perfect Lyonnaise Potatoes.

programme.title: Regional Italian-American Favorites
programme.desc: Test cook Bryan Roof makes host Julia Collin Davison a New York classic, Prosciutto Bread. Then, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges host Bridget Lancaster to a tasting of provolone cheese. Finally, test cook Ashley Moore shows Bridget how to make the easiest-ever Drop Meatballs.

programme.title: Italian Comfort Food Classics
programme.desc: Test cook Bryan Roof cooks host Julia Collin Davison a surprising Italian classic: Chicago Thin-Crust Pizza with Homemade Italian Sausage. Next, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges host Bridget Lancaster to a live taste test of jarred pasta sauce. Finally, test cook Lawman Johnson and host Bridget reveal the secrets to a perfect Pasta Fagioli.

programme.title: Holiday Roast and Potatoes
programme.desc: Hosts Bridget Lancaster and Julia Collin Davison streamline a classic recipe for Boneless Rib Roast with Yorkshire Pudding and Jus. Then, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges Bridget to a tasting of black tea. And finally, test cook Ashley Moore makes Bridget a family-favorite recipe for Lighthouse Inn Potatoes.

programme.title: The Kitchen Wisdom of Cecilia Chiang - The Long Walk
programme.desc: In this episode, Cecilia joins Laurence Jossel, chef and owner of Nopa. Like Cecilia, South African-born Jossel came a long way to open a restaurant in San Francisco. Cecilia shows Laurence how to make “beggar’s chicken,” a whole, stuffed chicken wrapped in lotus leaves and then clay, and baked for at least two hours.

programme.title: Nick Stellino: Storyteller in the Kitchen - The Ocean
programme.desc: Nick describes how growing up surrounded by the ocean and trips to the California Coastline inspire his recipes. Dishes include: Swordfish "Agrodolce" (Swordfish in a Sweet and Sour Sicilian Sauce) / Scallop with Red Pepper Zucchini Cream Sauce / Calamari with Sun Dried Tomatoes and Garbanzo Beans.

programme.title: Ciao Italia - Festival of the Seven Fishes
programme.desc: Mayor of Boston, the late (and great) Thomas M. Menino and Mary Ann celebrate their Italian American heritage by preparing a Christmas Eve banquet called “The Feast of the Seven Fishes.” Starting with Baccalà, then Skillet Fried Shrimp, then tuna, smelts, swordfish, calamari and clams, the tradition continues, and so do their appetites!

programme.title: Martin Yan's Chinatowns - Portuguese Influence
programme.desc: Martin explores the effect of the Portuguese influence on Chinese cooking in Macau, dines outdoors in the European style, and visits the “Miss Macau” restaurant. This episode's recipes include: Beauty Queen Beef, Spicy Clams with Pork Sausage, and Macau Clay Pot with Rice.

programme.title: Primal Grill - Out Of Africa
programme.desc: The focus is on Africa where live fire cooking began. Recipes include: Piri Piri Wings, Cape Malay Sosaties and Kenyan Lamb.

programme.title: Michael Chiarello's Napa - Primavera
programme.desc: Simple dishes show off the flavor of new peas and asparagus. We'll make a Cheater's Chicken Stock (when there's no homemade stock on hand), a bright green Spring Pea Soup, a quick, tender and lemony Peas and Cipolline dish, and Halibut with Asparagus and Salsa Genovese. We'll see the vineyards of the wine country covered in golden mustard blossoms, and drop in on the Mustard Festival.

programme.title: Lidia's Italian Table - Lamb Chops & Scaffata
programme.desc: Lidia Matticchio Bastianich cooks a universal favorite, marinated lamb chops, served with a memorable sauce, prepared with fresh mint leaves, wine, stock, citrus juices and herbs. The lamb is served with scaffata -- spring legumes simmered slowly – along with crispy, golden roasted potato wedges.

programme.title: Infusion - Fish
programme.desc: Today on Infusion, we look at the various way fish are used in cooking.

programme.title: Julia & Jacques Cooking at Home - Comfort Food
programme.desc: Poached chicken, chicken pot pie and rustic apple tart dessert. Julia and Jacques show how simple it is to poach a chicken with vegetables, mushrooms and a little white wine, and then take that poaching liquid and use it with the leftover poached chicken for a flaky crusted chicken pot pie. The same simple pastry Julia makes for the pot pie is perfect base for a rustic apple and dried fruit tart.

programme.title: Cucina Amore - Pasta with Capers and Anchovies
programme.desc: Quick and tasty pasta tossed with breadcrumbs, cheese, capers and anchovies served with juicy broiled tomatoes stuffed with rice.

programme.title: Patis Mexican Table - Carne Asada with La Familia
programme.desc: Pati learns that carne asada goes way beyond grilled meat in Sonora. It’s an important weekly ritual that brings the whole family together. Back home, Pati throws a carne asada in her backyard for her husband and boys. First, she teaches them the basics of a true Sonoran carne asada. Then, for dessert, a whipped peanut buttercream and grape galette.

programme.title: Foodie Guide to Québec City - Old Port
programme.desc: Food columnist Allison Van Rassel takes you on a local food tour of Québec City’s Old Port area. Allison chats with local chef Raphaël Vézina of the renowned 4 diamond Laurie Raphaël restaurant, visits Packwood on rue St-Paul street and discovers Auberge Saint-Antoine's Chez Muffy restaurant.

programme.title: Chefs A' Field: Green Cuisine - Milking Goodness
programme.desc: James Beard award winner Craig Stoll is serious about knowing exactly where his ingredients come from. Chef insists on meeting “the ladies” a herd of Holstein cows that provide milk for one of his favorite cheeses, Point Reyes Original Blue Farmstead Cheese. After milking the herd, he heads into the kitchen to prepare his famous Neapolitan pizza’s.

programme.title: Kimchi Chronicles - The Beef Chronicles
programme.desc: Tracing the history of beef, The Beef Chronicles tap into Korea’s religious, political and economic evolutions. Marja and her friends, food experts Diana and Jennifer, enjoy bulgogi in Seoul and then Marja eats it again in Andong, the spiritual capital of Korea, at a restaurant that produces thousands of ceramic jars of deonjang, a soybean paste that flavors much of Korean cooking.

programme.title: Great Chefs of America: Peter de Jong, Pierre Pollin, and Shane Gorringe
programme.desc: Recipes included with this episode: Benne Seed Shrimp and Crab Cakes, Sturgeon Napoleon with Foie Gras, and Chocolate Demerara. Restaurants include: Beaufort Inn in Beaufort, Le Titi de Paris in Arlington Heights, and Zoë’s in Covington.

programme.title: Superfoods with Chef Walter Staib - Quinoa
programme.desc: Chef Staib prepares Ahi Tuna Quinoa Salad, Quinoa Muesli, and Quinoa Cakes.

programme.title: Martin Yan - Quick and Easy - Sweet and Savory
programme.desc: Martin combines “the sweet” and “the savoury” to create these perfectly balanced dishes.

programme.title: Into the Outback with Abbey Holmes
programme.desc: Abbey travels to one of her favourite regions in the Northern Territory, paying a visit to her good friend Larry Guruwiwi.

programme.title: Into the Outback with Abbey Holmes
programme.desc: Abbey faces her fears and cage dives with ferocious tiger sharks. Back on land, she visits the local market for a tasty mango smoothie treat.

programme.title: Into the Outback with Abbey Holmes
programme.desc: As her adventure comes to an end, Abbey tries to catch the elusive barramundi one last time.

programme.title: David Rocco's Dolce Africa
programme.desc: Nairobi is known as a hard city, full of crime and political corruption, yet it’s as cosmopolitan and as cultured as it gets. In order to get to the heart of what it means to be Kenyan, David meets an eclectic variety of local artists and entrepreneurs who open his eyes to the joys, the challenges, and the vibrancy of life in the city and in the ghetto. Through music, art and performance, the people of Nairobi showcase their passions and heritage.

programme.title: David Rocco's Dolce Africa
programme.desc: The Rocco family journeys into the Maasai Mara to have a truly unique and life-changing experience: a Safari adventure to top anyone’s bucket list. They learn a thing or two about the circle of life, and spend a day with the nomadic Maasai tribe in their village. David gets a first-hand lesson in what it’s like to be a traditional Maasai warrior, from their roles in the community, to their rituals, and finally to their feasts.

programme.title: David Rocco's Dolce Africa
programme.desc: In a city that is still evolving in its identity in the post-Apartheid era, Johannesburg’s massive street art scene has caused it to become the cutting edge of modern art in Africa. David spends the day exploring the city with local graffiti artists, learning its history, and sampling its local cuisine. From roadside braai to hipster world markets, the food in Jo’burg proves that the city is at the epicenter of Africa's multifaceted cultural explosion.

programme.title: David Rocco's Dolce Africa
programme.desc: Known for being the home of South African heroes Nelson Mandela and Desmond Tutu, the township of Soweto was, in years past, known as a rough outskirt of Johannesburg. Through the locals and their delicious home-cooked BBQ, David discovers that there’s more to Soweto than meets the eye. With a powerful art and dance culture that’s full of passion and energy, this tight-knit community is growing into a formidable city of its own.

programme.title: David Rocco's Dolce Africa
programme.desc: With only 12-hours’ notice to attend a wedding in Tanzania’s capital city, it’s a good thing David is in Dar es Salaam, a major hub of fashion, textiles and trade on Africa’s East coast. Though he doesn’t manage to blend in with the locals at the wedding, he does get to sample the local food available at the Coco beach market, and to take a trip out of the bustling city to an easy-going fishing village to soak up its fresh seafood market. After spending time with a local hotel owner who built his entire property out of recycled and reclaimed materials, David revels in the laid-back attitude of these people and their tight-knit creative community.

programme.title: David Rocco's Dolce Africa
programme.desc: David speaks with several of the diaspora, Ethiopian-born people who have spent the majority of their lives abroad and have recently moved back to the capital city, Addis Ababa. He realizes that the true spirit of the country, with its reputation for poverty and famine, lies in the younger generations whose entrepreneurial drive and appreciation for preserving their unique culture are paving a new future for a modern Ethiopia.

programme.title: David Rocco's Dolce Africa
programme.desc: In the wake of a 7-year Italian occupation of Addis Ababa, a charming amount of Italian culture intertwines with the modern Ethiopia that the city now represents. David meets up with his friend Fabricio, a proud Italian who spent his childhood in Addis Ababa, and together they explore the remnants of a time long past. From espresso cafes to fine Italian eateries, Ethiopia’s capital has many unexpected surprises for Italians and Europeans alike.

programme.title: David Rocco's Dolce Africa
programme.desc: David journeys off the beaten path in Zanzibar to the small fishing village of Jambiani, where the motto is “Pole-Pole” or “Slowly-slowly," and the people are warm and inviting. He spends the day with an Italian hotel owner who loved the island so much she made it her home 8 years ago. During his stay on the island, he witnesses the daily life of the locals, from seaweed harvesting in the vast shallow waters at low-tide, to spear fishing for fresh octopus, to grilling fresh seafood right on the beach.

programme.title: David Rocco's Dolce Africa
programme.desc: Upon arriving in Zanzibar, a picturesque island known for its vast white sand beaches and its cultural melting-pot of African and Arabic culture, David is enchanted by the local people and their laid-back way of life. He meets a young business owner who builds houseboats and is gaining success in the tourism industry. Together they have fun cooking fresh local seafood for friends right on the boat. Later, David tours the winding streets and colourful markets of Stone Town with a couple of musicians and learns about the struggles of being a creative Muslim woman in this patriarchal society.

programme.title: David Rocco's Dolce Africa
programme.desc: Known for being the home of South African heroes Nelson Mandela and Desmond Tutu, the township of Soweto was, in years past, known as a rough outskirt of Johannesburg. Through the locals and their delicious home-cooked BBQ, David discovers that there’s more to Soweto than meets the eye. With a powerful art and dance culture that’s full of passion and energy, this tight-knit community is growing into a formidable city of its own.

programme.title: David Rocco's Dolce Africa
programme.desc: With only 12-hours’ notice to attend a wedding in Tanzania’s capital city, it’s a good thing David is in Dar es Salaam, a major hub of fashion, textiles and trade on Africa’s East coast. Though he doesn’t manage to blend in with the locals at the wedding, he does get to sample the local food available at the Coco beach market, and to take a trip out of the bustling city to an easy-going fishing village to soak up its fresh seafood market. After spending time with a local hotel owner who built his entire property out of recycled and reclaimed materials, David revels in the laid-back attitude of these people and their tight-knit creative community.

programme.title: David Rocco's Dolce Africa
programme.desc: David speaks with several of the diaspora, Ethiopian-born people who have spent the majority of their lives abroad and have recently moved back to the capital city, Addis Ababa. He realizes that the true spirit of the country, with its reputation for poverty and famine, lies in the younger generations whose entrepreneurial drive and appreciation for preserving their unique culture are paving a new future for a modern Ethiopia.

programme.desc: In the wake of a 7-year Italian occupation of Addis Ababa, a charming amount of Italian culture intertwines with the modern Ethiopia that the city now represents. David meets up with his friend Fabricio, a proud Italian who spent his childhood in Addis Ababa, and together they explore the remnants of a time long past. From espresso cafes to fine Italian eateries, Ethiopia’s capital has many unexpected surprises for Italians and Europeans alike.

programme.desc: David journeys off the beaten path in Zanzibar to the small fishing village of Jambiani, where the motto is “Pole-Pole” or “Slowly-slowly," and the people are warm and inviting. He spends the day with an Italian hotel owner who loved the island so much she made it her home 8 years ago. During his stay on the island, he witnesses the daily life of the locals, from seaweed harvesting in the vast shallow waters at low-tide, to spear fishing for fresh octopus, to grilling fresh seafood right on the beach.

programme.title: Andiamo! UPTOWN - Quebec City, Canada
programme.desc: Back to the snow Donna goes - but this time, she explores North America's oldest city and experiences local culture & cuisine as well as the city's most renowned hotel. PLUS - she'll visit the Ice Hotel!

programme.title: Andiamo! UPTOWN - Ocho Rios, Jamaica
programme.desc: Donna visits Ocho Rios, Jamaica and will explore the history, amazing culture, adventure and an amazing family focused resort. She'll also highlight a wonderful Jam-Italian fusion restaurant that is a MUST when visiting Ocho Rios!

programme.title: Andiamo! UPTOWN - Montego Bay, Jamaica
programme.desc: Donna visits Montego Bay & Negril where she will continue her exploration of Jamaica. In this episode, the Rose Hall Great House and its mysterious past are highlighted as well as Cliff Diving and Zip Lining. In addition, Donna will take a tour of the beautiful Half Moon Resort where she will learn more about her accommodations as well as learn how to golf and swim with a horse!

programme.title: Andiamo! UPTOWN - Montreal, Canada
programme.desc: Donna visits Montreal and will explore some of the great Quebecois cultural and epicurean wonders of this amazing metropolitan city. In addition she will try jet boating as well as learn more about why Montreal the unofficial "world headquarters" for the circus arts.

programme.title: Andiamo! UPTOWN - Catalina Island, California
programme.desc: In this episode, Donna journey's to one of California's most unique islands for some horseback riding, history, art and a bevy of food!

programme.title: Andiamo! UPTOWN - Jasper & Edmonton, Alberta, Canada Part 1
programme.desc: There's so much snow in this episode and Donna enjoys it to the fullest! From snow-biking to ice walking to staying at a world-renowned resort, you will enjoy winter offerings in more ways than you can imagine - which is why this episode is a "two-parter!"

programme.title: Andiamo! UPTOWN - Royal Caribbean Adventure Of The Seas Part 1
programme.desc: In this two-part episode, Donna cruises the Southern Caribbean aboard Royal Caribbean's "Adventure of the Seas" where she'll climb a rock wall, zip-line in St. Maarten, learn what it's like to be a captain of a cruise ship and much more.

programme.title: Andiamo! UPTOWN - Seville
programme.desc: Donna visits the south of Spain for some very unique culture & history, Flamenco dancing, fan painting as well as being kidnapped by some Bandoleros!!!

programme.title: Andiamo! UPTOWN - Royal Caribbean Adventure Of The Seas Part 2
programme.desc: In this continuation episode, Donna basks in the ships spa, takes a Yoga class, visits the engine room, displays some ice skating skills on- board "Adventure of the Seas" as well as exploring Antigua and Barbados.

programme.title: Andiamo! UPTOWN - Royal Caribbean Liberty Of The Seas
programme.desc: Donna sails on one of the world's largest cruise ships, Royal Caribbean International's "Liberty of the Seas." She will explore all of the unique onboard offerings including boxing & surfing on the high seas as well as parasailing on the shores of Royal Caribbean's private island, Labadee.

programme.title: Art Breakers - Commission Control
programme.desc: Fine art advisors Carol Lee Brosseau and Miller Gaffney are hired by TV star Mario Lopez to commission a piece of art inspired by Mario's new brand of tequila.

programme.title: Art Breakers - Vegas Vibes
programme.desc: A wealthy and eccentric Las Vegas couple calls in Carol Lee and Miller to help replace the bad art that came with their lavish new home.

programme.title: Art Breakers - Art From the Outback
programme.desc: The millionaire owner of a juicing empire hires Carol Lee and Miller to fill the walls of his New York City office including a very specific request for the restroom.

programme.title: Art Breakers - No Budget Required
programme.desc: Miller hunts for art for a hard-to-please New York City socialite while Carol Lee tries to bring in big money at the country's top art show for photography.

programme.title: The Method - Kuma Films
programme.desc: Filmmakers Todd and Joe Robins are profiled in this series that delves into the work and artistic process of content creators of viral videos.

programme.title: The Method - Creative Kids
programme.desc: In this episode of The Method, we look at the inspiring and artistic world of creative kids.

programme.title: The Method - London in The Streets
programme.desc: Street performances are explored. Included: a ride in a Jaguar XE a look at innovative London street artists.

programme.title: Million Dollar Listing: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Tracy travels to Dubai to earn a listing that could change her life, and hangs with friend and local celeb Caroline Stanbury. Altman hunts down a mystery property in Malibu to house dozens of luxury cars for an important client.

programme.title: Million Dollar Listing: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Josh Flagg whisks boyfriend Bobby off to Paris to propose. Josh Altman takes on a listing with an unpredictable homeowner.

programme.title: Million Dollar Listing: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Altman throws an epic launch event for a modern with a 48-million-dollar price tag, and a social media twist. Tracy gets creative to find a buyer for her new WeHo modern in a market that is oversaturated with new construction.

programme.title: Million Dollar Listing: Los Angeles
programme.desc: James negotiates the purchase of the iconic Sunset Strip Hustler building. Josh Altman gets caught in a vulnerable position when an offer comes in on Carman Crest at an inopportune time.

programme.title: Million Dollar Listing: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Madison returns with a Malibu beachside listing that needs help after sitting stale for a year. Josh Altman supports his fiancée Heather as she lists an entire condo building that would be the biggest sale of her career.

programme.title: Million Dollar Listing: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The Brits host a luxurious open house for their $45 million dollar Bel Air listing, and sparks fly when Flagg and Altman come face to face.

programme.title: Million Dollar Listing: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Josh Altman and Josh Flagg have an explosive showdown at the Brits' property. Madison works against the clock to close the deal on his PCH listing. David enlists James' help to deal with the emotional sale of his own home. Josh Altman celebrates the launch of his book, but Heather shares some news that could change their lives forever.

programme.title: Million Dollar Listing: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The results from Heather's pregnancy test put things into perspective for Josh Altman. James and David's St. Ives listing is ready to hit the market, but tensions with the seller may cause them to walk away from the listing.

programme.title: Million Dollar Listing: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Sworn enemies Altman and Flagg team up and hit the road in hopes of landing a major listing in La Jolla. Tracy gets creative to sell a Hollywood Hills artists enclave.

programme.title: Million Dollar Listing: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The four brokers are back to tackle the booming Los Angeles real estate market. Josh Flagg is determined to stay on top, vying for an $8 million listing from a long lost high school "friend." Josh Altman promises a busy young millionaire that he will find him the perfect house in just one day. British transplants James Harris and David Parnes get creative to sell a $5.75 million dollar hillside modern.

programme.title: Tiny House Nation: 320 Sq Ft Tiny Zen Den
programme.desc: Brian and Devon are eager to put down roots in their first home

programme.title: Tiny House Nation: Tiny Times Two
programme.desc: John and Zack head to Texas to help a family rebuild after losing their dream home

programme.title: Tiny House Nation: 200 Sq. Ft. Family-Friendly House
programme.desc: Adam and Gabrielle want a tiny house that they can raise their growing family.

programme.title: Tiny House Nation: 230 Sq. Ft. Travel Well House
programme.desc: Allen and Alexa are newlyweds looking to expand their online travel magazine.

programme.title: Tiny House Nation: 250 Sq Ft "World Traveler's Home"
programme.desc: Kyle and Whitney have been all over the world exploring and learning.

programme.title: Tiny House Nation: 380 Sq Ft Derby House
programme.desc: Scott and Marianne both grew up in horse racing towns.

programme.title: Tiny House Nation: No Fall Zone
programme.desc: This week, John and Zack head north to Coeur d'Alene.

programme.title: Tiny House Nation: 320 Sq Ft Tiny Zen Den
programme.desc: Brian and Devon are eager to put down roots in their first home

programme.title: Tiny House Nation: Tiny Times Two
programme.desc: John and Zack head to Texas to help a family rebuild after losing their dream home

programme.title: Tiny House Nation: 200 Sq. Ft. Family-Friendly House
programme.desc: Adam and Gabrielle want a tiny house that they can raise their growing family.

programme.title: Newton GenNEXT | All Decked Out
programme.desc: The apprentices learn the basics of framing a deck while the chimney gets demo’ed. The interior designer creates a custom pattern for the floor. The flue for the wood burning stove is installed.

programme.title: Newton GenNEXT | This Old House University
programme.desc: The apprentices learn how to frame a wall in the master bedroom, build a drain stack for the master bath, and lay decking on the front porch. The homeowners visit their kitchen cabinet designer.

programme.title: Newton GenNEXT | Approaching Half Way
programme.desc: Flooring is used to make a barn door. Roger teaches a horticulture class. Tommy and Charlie find an uninsulated crawl space. The garage floor gets radiant heat and the front porch gets columns.

programme.title: Newton GenNEXT | Duct Dynasty
programme.desc: The apprentices get a lesson in roofing, Kevin watches how an elaborate Chippendale railing is put together, the basement gets moisture prevention, and Richard shows how ductwork is put together.

programme.title: Newton GenNEXT | Tommy's Flair for Flares
programme.desc: Kevin reviews the progress being made upstairs. Most of the new work is at the back of the house. New gas lines are installed. Tommy builds a shower bench and double hung replacement windows.

programme.title: Newton GenNEXT | Time for Trim
programme.desc: Granite is laid for the stove. Nathan installs a porch ceiling. Kevin sees a Rhode Island home with pine trim. Richard reviews component placement at the mechanical wall. Mauro fixes holes in plaster.

programme.title: Newton GenNEXT | Homeowners Pitch In
programme.desc: At the Newton Project, trim interior columns, stair treads, and stained-glass windows are installed. Kevin tours a flooring factory. Richard teaches a plumbing class.

programme.title: Newton GenNEXT | Salvage Helps the Bottom Line
programme.desc: Norm fits an old door. Roger sees a premade stone wall installed in sections. Kevin visits a career day for the trades. Twin built-in beds are made in Rhode Island. Tommy reinstalls a corner cabinet.

programme.title: Newton GenNEXT | Graduation Day
programme.desc: Roger explains why preventative tree work is needed. Homeowner Liz gets a tiling lesson. The original newel post is discovered to be walnut. The apprentices graduate after ten weeks of hard work.

programme.title: Newton GenNEXT | Homeowner Going the Distance
programme.desc: Norm lays composite decking. Charlie makes exterior decorative brackets. Kevin watches a quartz countertop get installed. Roger paves the front walk. Liz fits her stained-glass window.

programme.title: Newton GenNEXT | Final Touches
programme.desc: Kevin finds Tommy and Charlie installing a fireback. Roger returns the flowers he saved. The island countertop goes on. Kevin watches a crew install a garage door. The wood stove arrives.

programme.title: Newton GenNEXT | Move in Day
programme.desc: It’s the wrap of another great project. Kevin tours the renovated house with the homeowners. Their kids and Joe’s parents arrive to check out the new and improved home.

programme.title: The Charleston Houses 2018 | Southern Charm, Season Premiere
programme.desc: A new two-project series begins in Charleston, South Carolina: a brick 1840s “single house” and a multi-generational 1890s home.

programme.title: The Charleston Houses 2018 | Demo Time
programme.desc: Demo starts on the Charleston projects. Judith talks planting options with Roger, who visits a suitable nursery. Kevin tours the American College of the Building Arts. Richard goes privy diving.

programme.title: The Charleston Houses 2018 | Brick and Mortar

programme.title: Marry Me In NYC: Cassaundra & Joko Katie & Tim

programme.title: Mary Mary: Catch-Up with Mary Mary

programme.title: Mary Mary: I'm Gonna Kill Somebody!
programme.desc: Tina's confession on the radio about Teddy's infidelities leaves Erica panicked that her sister is hurting the Mary Mary brand. Tina's mess-up costs Warryn money, and Erica nearly collapses from exhaustion.

programme.title: Mary Mary: Twisted Sisters
programme.desc: Erica is forced to go to an event alone because Tina won't go. When Tina refuses to do Erica a favor, lines are drawn. Warryn pushes Erica to quit Mary Mary.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 2, Day Eight" - With just four chefs remaining, the competition becomes fierce. Who among them has what it takes to be head chef at Gordon Ramsay's new restaurant?

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 2, Day Nine" - The contestants taste Chef Ramsay's signature dish and are given twenty minutes to replicate it. Tensions rise amongst the chefs amidst accusations of cheating.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 2, Day Ten (Part One)" - From the menu to the décor, the two finalists must prove their worth by running their own restaurants. Both will complete a dinner service with help from their former competitors.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 2, Day Ten (Part Two)" - In the season finale, the final two contestants prepare one last dinner service for Chef Ramsay.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 3, Day One" - Tyrannical chef Gordon Ramsay returns for a third summer to tutor and torture aspiring chefs. The winner will receive a job as head chef at Nevada's Green Valley Ranch resort.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 3, Day Two" - The two teams face off in a food-prep challenge that rewards the winners with a chance to spend time with Chef Ramsay away from the kitchen.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 3, Day Three" - Chef Ramsay orders the remaining contestants to cook breakfast for visiting service members. The winning team will receive a day of rest, and the losers get kitchen patrol duty.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 3, Day Four" - On the fourth day, the remaining chefs compete in a blindfold taste test. The losers must accept a difficult punishment while the winners dine with Chef Ramsay.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 3, Day Five" - To advance in this challenge, the seven remaining chefs must purchase and prepare food for a wedding reception.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 3, Day Six" - Melissa joins the men in a competition to see which team can prepare better lobster dishes. But there's a catch: the teams must kill their crustaceans first.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: J. Willy's
programme.desc: Located in Indiana, J. Willy's Bar and Grille is deep in debt. When Chef Ramsay arrives, he challenges the owners to use fresh ingredients, but the inexperienced chefs get overwhelmed.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Hannah and Mason's
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits French bistro Hannah and Mason's. Owned by two friends who lack business skills and motivation, the restaurant administers bounced checks to the staff.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Jack's Waterfront
programme.desc: Ramsay arrives at Jack's Waterfront and is appalled by the lack of fresh seafood and inattentive management. The general manager's excessive socializing with patrons may sink the place.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Sabatiello's
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits Sabatiello's and finds a hot-headed owner who is deep in debt. The owner gets so angry at his employees and Ramsay's criticism that he shuts down the eatery himself.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Fiesta Sunrise
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay helps out a family-run Mexican restaurant called Fiesta Sunrise — which is in deep financial trouble and extremely dirty. Can Ramsay get the family on the path to success?

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Sante Le Brea
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay travels to LA to inspect Sante La Brea. He discovers a financially strapped owner who isn't respected by his staff. And an incident that occurs in the eatery leads to a police visit.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Café 36
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay drops by Café 36, a French-American eatery in Illinois. The couple who own the place are lacking in business skills and need Ramsay's expertise to teach them how to draw in a crowd.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Hot Potato Cafe
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay travels to Philadelphia, Pennsylvania to visit Hot Potato Cafe. He finds an owner sapped of passion who has created a toxic environment filled with negativity.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Flamango's
programme.desc: While in New Jersey, Chef Ramsay visits Flamango's, an outdated eatery in need of help. Ramsay suggests a major overhaul, but the owner thinks it's best to simply shut down the restaurant.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Bazzini
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay journeys to Ridgewood, New Jersey to rejuvenate Bazzini, an Italian eatery hampered by sluggish service and a lackluster kitchen staff.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Finale Part 2" - The moment that our designers have been waiting and hoping for since the very beginning, the opportunity to show at New York Fashion Week, has finally arrived. With only four competitors remaining, who will ultimately have what it takes to win Project Runway?

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Reunion Special" - All of the designers reunite one last time to discuss their experiences on Project Runway together, settle any last feuds that still exist in the group, and reminisce about their time on this season. Tim Gunn hosts.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Road to the Runway" - In this season's casting special, "Road to the Runway," sixteen new designers will be introduced with a behind-the-scenes look from their casting auditions, home visits, casting submissions, and sit-down interviews. Tim Gunn will present the designers in carefully carved out categories that will lead you into the season premiere.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Mad Dash Mayhem" - In the season premiere, sixteen new designers meet Tim and Heidi at Madison Square Garden, where they scramble across the seats to gather fabric for their first challenge. In the workroom, they reveal their strengths and weaknesses as they create looks to show who they are as designers.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "It's All In The Cards" - The designers are dealt a big surprise in the first Unconventional Materials Challenge of the season! Each designer must create a wearable look using greeting cards as their main textile. Ashley Tisdale joins the judges.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Shut Up and Sew" - In the first Team Challenge of the season, the designers are paired up and treated to a day on a Celebrity Cruise ship. For some of the duos, the friendly seas are left behind and they hit some rocky water in the workroom. Tracee Ellis Ross guest judges.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Fashion Flip" - The designers finally get to go to Mood and they are thrilled! They must put a modern and unique twist on a classic design. Mad Men's Kiernan Shipka joins as a guest judge.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Gunn and Heid" - Tensions arise when the designers split into two teams and battle for their fabrics in a fierce paintball competition. After capturing their fabrics for a six-piece collection, the teams receive a big surprise once the paint dries on the battlefield! Kelly Osbourne and Lisa Perry guest judge.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Lace To The Finish" - In an episode full of surprises, Heidi challenges the designers to create lingerie for her line. The exhausted designers get a rude awakening on the runway. Actress Bella Thorne serves as a guest judge.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Haute Tech Couture" - In their second Unconventional Materials Challenge, the designers go dumpster diving for recycled electronics in order to merge the worlds of fashion and technology. Actress Paula Patton and Editor in Chief of Marie Claire magazine, Anne Fulenwider, guest judge.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Broadway Or Bust" - The magic and glamour of Broadway serve as inspiration for the designers' new challenge as they create fashionable looks based on the musical Finding Neverland. One designer upstages the entire competition. Supermodel Coco Rocha guest judges.

programme.desc: Después de la caída de un infame narco-líder, el coronel Diana está lista para tomarse un descanso de la policía y trabajar para arreglar su matrimonio. programme.title: El Mono
programme.desc: A dos medio hermanas la vida les dará un giro radical luego de evento dramático.

programme.title: El Talisman
programme.desc: Tras perder un rancho en Texas, Camila Nájera y su familia se mudan a Fresno, California. El destino los llevará a ser vecinos del despiadado Gregorio Negrete, dueño del rancho "El Alcatraz". Gregorio ha vivido en guerra con Los Aceves, antiguos dueños de "El Talismán", y su único sueño es poseer ese rancho. Camila se verá envuelta en este juego de ambición y poder, que la lleva a conocer a dos hombres que le cambiarán la vida.

programme.title: El Show de Willi
programme.desc: Willi estrena su propio reality show. Todo el mundo está en vilo y pronto se revelará su verdadera intención.

programme.title: Jodha Akbar
programme.desc: Jodha Akbar es un drama épico ambientado en el siglo XVI que relata la historia sobre un matrimonio político de conveniencia entre un emperador mogol, Akbar y una princesa Rajput, Jodha Bai. La trama se centra en cómo éste matrimonio político trae el amor entre ellos en una medida que cambió el destino de la India, así mismo retrata las guerras de ese tiempo junto con las relaciones entre los mogoles y los Rajputs. Gran parte de la historia recrea el funcionamiento de las instituciones icónicas de la época como las reinas, los tribunales, las cortesanas, los ministros y su influencia en la historia de amor de Akbar y Jodha Bai. La serie también destaca cómo el Emperador Mogol Jalaluddin adquiere el título de Akbar del pueblo.

programme.title: Agua en la Boca
programme.desc: Es una historia de amor prohibido entre dos jóvenes, hijos de familias rivales. La hermosa Danielle Cassoulet (de descendencia francés) y el aventurero Luca Bellini (de descendencia italiana). El conflicto entre el cassoulet y la familia Bellini es viejo, siendo antes los mejores amigos de la juventud las matriarcas de esas familias hoy no pueden permanecer de pie debido a una disputa amorosa en el pasado en el que Françoise Cassoulet, y la abuela de Dany se peleaban por el amor de un mismo hombre.

programme.title: El Mono
programme.desc: A dos medio hermanas la vida les dará un giro radical luego de evento dramático.

programme.title: La Violetera
programme.desc: Soledad, Una Violetera Madrileña, Conoce A Fernando, Un Joven Aristócrata Que Se Enamora Perdidamente De Ella. Al Morir Su Hermano, Fernando Ha De Hacerse Cargo De Las Obligaciones De La Familia Y Renunciar Al Amor De Soledad Para Casarse Con La Novia Que Iba Destinada A Su Hermano, En Pro De Los Intereses Familiares. Pasados Los Anos Soledad Se Ha Convertido En Una Famosa Cantante Y Fernando Ha Obtenido Una Brillante Carrera Politica

programme.title: Angelitos Del Trapecio
programme.desc: Torpe y asustado Capulina se ve envuelto en una aventura en las peligrosas alturas del trapecio, todo para ayudar al triunfo de una bella trapecista.

programme.title: Embrujo De Amor
programme.desc: En incierto lugar y época se ubica esta historia de amor, en la que el príncipe de una tribu de gitanos se enamora de la hija de un noble y muere por ella.

Heung-seon, a faithful friend of the King, joins PARK to prevent KIM to usurp the throne by finding it first.

Detective Jong-Hoon investigates the murder case and talks with his Kim Byeong-Gook's co-workers at his office. His colleagues though are not very forthcog with details. Besides, Lee Mi-Rye, who was very close with Kim Byeong-Gook, they seem to be hiding something.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "A Tenor's Loving Care" - A famous opera singer (Carroll O'Connor) makes a play for Ann while Don tries to get an interview with the temperamental celebrity.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "Leaving the Nest Is for the Birds" - A family dinner put on by Ann to show that life in New York City is safe is spoiled by an alleged peeping Tom (Jerry Van Dyke).

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "You Have to Know Someone to Be Unknown" - Finding out that Broadway producer Harold J. Davis (Herbert Rudley) is seeking a fresh-faced unknown for his next play, Ann goes out of her way to get recognized by him.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "The Honeymoon Apartment" - Ann's cheap cousin (Warren Berlinger) and his brand new bride insist on using her apartment for their honeymoon.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "This Little Piggy Had a Ball" - While bowling with Donald just before she has to accept an award for another actress, Ann reads about another bowler who bowled with his toes...and makes the mistake of trying to do it herself.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "Author, Author" - For an upcoming audition, Ann needs a comedic line and seeks help from both Donald and a washed-up comedy writer, neither of whom prove to be adequate.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "The Mating Game" - While working on an expose on the inner workings of a game show called "The Mating Game," Donald sends Ann to go undercover as a bachelorette.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "Pass the Potatoes, Ethel Merman" - A walk-on role for a play starring Ethel Merman in a revival of "Gypsy" leaves Ann awestruck.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "The Good Skate" - Ann auditions for a soda commercial that requires a performance on roller skates, something she has a little difficulty with.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "Black, White and Read All Over" - After yet another rejection of Donald's unpublished novel, Ann offers to submit it to her father, who knows a publisher who's a customer at his restaurant.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "To Each Her Own" - Donald does a news story on computer dating and takes Ann along for the ride. Much to Ann's chagrin, the girl that the computer dating service assigns to her boyfriend is a lot like her.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "The Apartment" - Donald gets Ann to house sit at his apartment, and she runs into another friend of his (Bill Bixby), who is also staying there.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "Absence Makes the Heart Grow Nervous" - Before Ann goes to Philadelphia for a play that's making a nationwide tour, Donald tries to show her a good time by giving her a night on the town...and another night...and another night...

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "The Philadelphia Story" - Unable to tolerate life without Ann, Donald goes to Philadelphia to write a review of Ann's play.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "There's Nothing to Be Afreud of But Freud Himself" - Donald writes an article on a newfangled psychological exam, and he tries to use it on Ann and the Baumans.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "The Collaborators" - Ann and Donald decide to work on a play about her life, but creative differences get in the way.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "When in Rome" - An Italian movie director spots Ann and wants her to star in his next movie...and perform a nude scene.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Alex Velluto - Thirsty
programme.desc: Alex Velluto is a stand-up comedian and Diet Coke drinker from Salt Lake City, Utah. He has performed at comedy festivals all over the country including the Boston Comedy Festival, Big Sky Comedy Festival, and the Seattle International Comedy Competition. He was named “Best of Fest” at the Golden Spike Comedy Festival and is the winner of the Finger Lakes Comedy Festival in Ithaca, NY. In 2016, Alex was voted “Best Comedian” by City Weekly Magazine. His debut comedy special “Alex Velluto: Spurious” is currently streaming on Amazon.com.

programme.title: Jason Hewlett - Father Time
programme.desc: The Award-Winning One-Man Show of Jason Hewlett The Entertainer will have you laughing until it hurts. Comedy, Music, Impressions, and Standing Ovations make Jason the perfect entertainer. His brand of Hilarious G-Rated Entertainment is unlike anything you have ever enjoyed. Over 2,000 shows for more than 1 Million audience members in his incredible career make Jasonís show an event you will remember for years to come.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Nazareth - American by Choice
programme.desc: Award Winning Comedian Nazareth, has been seen by over 40 Million people around the world through live concerts, TV and Radio broadcasts. His list of TV appearances include: Comedy Central, ABC Family, NBC, CBS, and TBN.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Brian Bates - Uber Important
programme.desc: Turning to comedy after twenty years in corporate America, Brian Bates jokes about ubering his hecklers home, meeting women while hiking, and people who dont believe in God but do believe in wrestling.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Mark Poolos - One Wife, Two Daughters, and Zero Influence
programme.desc: Mark stands 6'7" weighs in at 350 technically a giant however he is very weak and a wimp. In his routines, he weaves the story of his life as a bumbling jolly giant in his fast engaging storytelling style. He has been compared to Louie Anderson. Mark is a true road dog, performing in 40 states and all across Canada. Mark's ultimate dream is to do a film that people actually will have seen.

programme.title: Jason Love - Jokes On Me
programme.desc: One of today's busiest comics, Jason Love has appeared on HBO, Comedy Central, America's Got Talent, and over 20 national broadcasts.Jason works clean and incorporates music, making him a favorite for companies like Google, Chevron, Farmers, and Costco.Says L.A. Weekly: "Jason Love is comedy that brings people together."From the Hollywood Improv to Carolines on Broadway, Jasons audience continues to grow. He has performed overseas for the troops and on the seas for cruise lines. Jason was a finalist at the Cabo Comedy Festival and at the World Series of Comedy in Vegas.Jasons non-profit, Love &amp Laughter, brings free shows to cancer support communities and others in need. His podcast is produced by Levity Entertainment. He is represented by Don Casino Productions.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Eric O Shea - Life: It's Not Your Fault
programme.desc: Eric O'Shea has been active in the comedy business for 25 years. He has performed in L.A. with Betty White at the Creative Emmy Awards and has appeared on America's Got Talent TV Show. Every year since 1997, Eric has performed an average of 70 shows a year, and has received 7 nominations as the “National College Comedian of the Year”

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Shayne Smith - Prison for Wizards
programme.desc: Former Gang Member, current comedian, future famous comedian. Shayne Smith is the runner up in the Wiseguys’ 2015 Funniest Person In Utah competition, winner of the 2015 Salt City Comedy Superstar contest and most recently voted best Alternative Comedian of 2016 by City Weekly.

programme.title: Moody Molavi - Remove Before Flight
programme.desc: The christian comic is married to his high school sweetheart, who later became his stepsister through the marriage of their parents to each other. That’s where the fun begins as Moody skillfully shares his life experiences.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Mark Christopher Lawrence - Clean Outta Compton
programme.desc: Mark Christopher Lawrence (born May 22, 1964) is an American character actor, stand-up comedian, and voice-over artist. He is perhaps best known for his role as esoteric D.J., Tone Deaf, in the 1994 satirical rap mockumentary, Fear of a Black Hat. He has co-starred in popular films such as Terminator 2: Judgment Day, Planet of the Apes, Lost Treasure and The Pursuit of Happiness. Lawrence can currently be seen in his regular role as Big Mike on the NBC series Chuck. He has made guest appearances on many television programs, most notably Heroes, My Name Is Earl, Crossing Jordan, Dharma & Greg, Malcolm in the Middle, Touched by an Angel, Malcolm & Eddie, Men Behaving Badly, Seinfeld, Murphy Brown, and Martin. He is also featured on the Radio Series Adventures in Odyssey as "Ed Washington".

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Josh Sneed - Live in the Dessert
programme.desc: Hailing from the great city of Cincinnati, Ohio, Josh comes to Dry Bar to bring “new life” to his comedy. Being funny 24/7 can be difficult, but Josh Sneed does it. Watch “Live in the Dessert” by Josh Sneed now!

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Steve Soelberg - Pirate Hymns
programme.desc: Steve Soelberg might actually be a human ray of sunshine. Riffing on his ultra-conservative upbringing, this special balances jokes about the tune of church hymns with hilarious observations of the seemingly mundane.

programme.title: Brian Moote - Getting Schooled
programme.desc: Brian Moote started performing stand up in 2005 while he was working as a teacher in the Seattle School District. He then went to graduate school to get a masters degree in social work because who doesn't love crippling debt? I mean, this is America. After graduating he moved to LA and now tours the country telling jokes. He has made TV appearances on the USA Network's "Characters Welcome," Nickelodeon's "Nickmom's Nite Out," MTV's "Money from Strangers" and AXS TV's "Gotham Live." You should come out and see him tell jokes... DO IT!!!

programme.title: RiffTrax Shorts: Back to School with Joan Miller
programme.desc: The stars of Mystery Science Theater 3000 bring their comedic riffing treatment to this fashion themed educational short. Join Mike, Kevin, and Bill as they go Back to School with Joan Miller!

programme.title: RiffTrax: Santa and the Ice Cream Bunny
programme.desc: The stars of Mystery Science Theater 3000 give their comedic riffing treatment to this truly bizarre family Christmas movie! It’s one of the strangest and most baffling pieces of outsider art that Mike, Kevin and Bill have ever riffed. Please join us in experiencing: Santa & the Ice Cream Bunny.

programme.title: RiffTrax Shorts: Things Are Different Now
programme.desc: The stars of Mystery Science Theater 3000 bring their comedic riffing treatment to this short about how things change. Join Mike, Kevin, and Bill for Things Are Different Now!

programme.title: RiffTrax: The Power
programme.desc: Join Mike, Kevin, Bill, and a harmless little tiki idol that Kevin brought back from Hawaii for The Power! This feature is a parody and contains the original movie combined with a comedic commentary by Mike, Kevin and Bill from RiffTrax (formerly of MST3K).

programme.title: RIFFTRAX SHORT - Short: Shapes We Live With
programme.desc: The stars of MST3K bring their comedic riffing treatment to this short all about spheres, cylinders and pyramids. You’ll laugh, you’ll cry, you might just learn something (but only if you don’t know what a circle is). Don’t be a square, join Mike, Kevin, and Bill, the Riffers We Live With, for Shapes We Live With!

programme.title: RIFFTRAX - Mind Ripper
programme.desc: In a remote bunker in the desert, unthinkable experiments are taking place. Experiments where horror legend Wes Craven sells his name and credibility to a movie in exchange for a writing credit for his son Jonathan! This feature is a parody and contains the original movie combined with a comedic commentary by Mike, Kevin and Bill from RiffTrax (formerly of MST3K).

programme.title: RIFFTRAX SHORT - People Soup
programme.desc: The stars of MST3K bring their comedic riffing treatment to the Oscar nominated short People Soup! Join Mike, Kevin and Bill as they serve up a hilarious bowl of People Soup!

programme.title: RiffTrax: Bloody Pit Of Horror
programme.desc: The stars of MST3K bring their comedic riffing treatment to this Italian horror flick starring Mickey Hargitay as the reincarnation of the Marquis de Sade! Join Mike, Kevin, and Bill as they venture into the Bloody Pit Of Horror!

programme.title: RiffTrax: Kill And Kill Again
programme.desc: It’s your standard South African martial arts extravaganza based around root vegetable gasoline. You’re gonna love it, and love it again, with Mike, Kevin and Bill! This feature is a parody and contains the original movie combined with a comedic commentary by Mike, Kevin and Bill from RiffTrax (formerly of Mystery Science Theater 3000).
